item.title: Report E-2023080681
item.description:
Report E-2023080681

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft area of the concrete dock floor and an 8ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released. First Call Environmental personnel removed 29 boxes that contained two (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs that were impacted by the released material. The non-damaged boxes (a total 67 boxes) were restacked and shipped onto the consignee. First Call Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted areas and First Call Environmental personnel recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard and plastic jugs were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080711
item.description:
Report X-2023080711

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged in transit on trailer 458218 out of 219 hage. outer container was wet.upon inspection 4 of the six items had loose caps leaking out approx 10 oz of content. DescribePack: failure was due to loose caps causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spillage remaine on outer container itself.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080674 SequenceEvent: loaded onto a trailer to load. Package handler handled it wrong and the caps came loose DescribePack: hole on the side of the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put into a hazmat tote and placed down in the damage hazmat cage, 2. X-2023080684 SequenceEvent: improperly handled while loading DescribePack: loose cap due to being handled improperly DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in a hazmat tote wrapped to contain the leakage

item.title: Report X-2023081880
item.description:
Report X-2023081880

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS ALREADY LOADED ON THE PD VEHICLE WHEN THE SPILL WAS DISCOVERED. THE PACKAGE WAS NOT BRACED PROPERLY, CAUSING IT TO MOVE WHILE THE DRIVER WAS CONDUCTING HIS ROUTE, EVENTUALLY CAUSING THE DAMAGE TO TAKE PLACE. DescribePack: THE CAPS LOOSENED, DUE TO REPEATED MOVING OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WITHIN THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DRIVER NOTIFIED STATION PERSONNEL, WHO REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE VAN AND PLACED IT IN A HAZ TOTE.

Report X-2023080630

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the wet package in the damage hazmat cage. I repacked it in a salvage drum and completed the required reports. DescribePack: The glass container was shattered and all 2.5 liters of content spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023080527
item.description:
Report X-2023080527

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: WHITE MARSH
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM THE TRAILER, ALREADY LEAKING BADLY. THE PACKAGE HANDLER JUST PUT THE PACKAGE OFF TO THE SIDE AWAY FROM ANYTHING THEY WERE WORKING. DescribePack: HE LID HAD WORKED ITSELF COMPLETELY OFF, AND MORE THAN HALF OF THE CONENTS SPILLED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I IMMEDIATELY WENT OVER TO THE UNLOAD TO GET THE BOX. I PUT THE LID ON THE LEAKING JUG, THEN PLACED THE ENTIRE PACKAGE INSIDE A BIN LINED WITH A HEAVY DUTY HAZMAT BAG.
